section.title: Jetty Embedded HelloWorld
section.para: This section provides a tutorial that shows how you can quickly develop embedded code against the Jetty API.

section.title: Downloading the Jars
section.para: Jetty is decomposed into many jars and dependencies to achieve a minimal footprint by selecting the minimal set of jars. Typically it is best to use something like Maven to manage jars, however this tutorial uses an aggregate Jar that contains all of the Jetty classes in one Jar. You can manually download the aggregate jetty-all.jar using curl) or a browser.

note.para: The central maven repository has started to aggressively reject/deny access to the repository from the wget command line tool (due to abusive use of the tool by some groups). The administrators of the central maven repository have stated that the recommended command line download tool is now curl.

section.screen: > mkdir Demo > cd Demo > curl -o jetty-all-uber.jar http://central.maven.org/maven2/org/eclipse/jetty/aggregate/jetty-all/@project.version@/jetty-all-@project.version@-uber.jar

section.title: Writing a HelloWorld Example
section.para: The Embedding Jetty section contains many examples of writing against the Jetty API. This tutorial uses a simple HelloWorld handler with a main method to run the server. You can either download or create in an editor the file HelloWorld.java with the following content:

section.title: Compiling the HelloWord example
section.para: The following command compiles the HelloWorld class:
section.screen: > mkdir classes > javac -d classes -cp jetty-all-uber.jar HelloWorld.java
